thread.title: ‘Thon’s gonna be the best big-man in the NBA’
thread.title_full: ‘Thon’s gonna be the best big-man in the NBA’

title: ‘Thon’s gonna be the best big-man in the NBA’
text:
Jabari Parker predicts Thon Maker will be the ‘best seven-foot player in this league’ 10 minutes ago by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS THON Maker just earned the first start of his young NBA career, but that was after receiving a massive compliment from one of his teammates. 
The Australian big-man has only seen limited minutes — mostly in garbage time — averaging 2.1 points and 1.2 rebounds so far in his rookie season in the league. 
While we’re yet to see consistent, extended minutes from Maker, his teammate, Jabari Parker, predicts big things in the seven-footer’s future. 
“You can quote me, right now,” Parker said when asked by the THE LEAD about Maker’s potential. 
“Thon Maker’s gonna be the best seven-foot player in this league. He’s going to. He’s that good.” Thon Maker. Source: Getty Images 
Maker’s wingspan, unique skillset, and size have always intrigued front office executives, but, on a relatively deep Bucks team, he’s struggled to see minutes. 
Parker suggested that, if Maker was on a team that wasn’t vying for a playoff spot, he’d earn more minutes and post more significant numbers. 
“Say if, for instance, he was on a team like Philly or one of the teams that’s in the low .500s, he’d be averaging 15 and 10, easily, because his skillset is so amazing,” Parker said. 
“He can shoot the ball, he can put it on the ground, and he’s athletic. he has that time of athleticism Quick first step for his size, agile, great hands, good feel for the game, and it’s only going to get better.” 
In an odd series of events, Maker replaced Parker in the starting lineup after these comments; a reaction to the Bucks’ four-game losing streak. View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
